string.text: Oh, hello. What's up?
What do you need, stalker?.
You here to buy some shit?
Tell me about this place.

Welcome to the 100 Rads bar, my little oasis in this irradiated hellhole. Thanks to Duty, this neighbourhood is among the safest in the entire Zone. You'll be safe too, as long as you behave. Stalkers from all over come here to eat, rest, talk, find information or seek work. So, what are you after? What can the old Barkeep do for you today?
Any stash information for sale?

Heh, yeah... Sometimes, when stalkers around here grab a bottle, they drunkenly slip info on their stashes. Don't know what they keep in there, but what I do know is the value. Seven thousand and it's all yours.
Sure. Here. %c[d_orange][7000 RU]
Much appreciated.
Hello Barkeep. I have brought someone you might want to see.
Uh-huh. Ah, Hip. Here, friend, have a drink on the house while I talk to her privately.
Thanks. I'll wait...

...Alright. Hip now knows what she needs to do, and wanted me to tell you while she readies up; she'll be going past the Barrier to Zaton, to drop off some artefact containers for Beard, who urgently needs them to secure and finalize a lucrative deal with some artefact collectors on the outside. She also said she refuses to go on the trip without you. So are you ready?
Yeah, I'm ready. We'll take the containers now.
Almost, I just need a few minutes to get everything together.
I need to pass through.
What's the current situation?

Things are quiet with Freedom. Of course, we're keeping a close eye on them - gotta keep our guard up. Other than that, the Bandits are getting organized, but still remain more an annoyance than a true threat. The Blue Man Group to the west and northwest don't seem as interested in us as much as we are in them, but there's no way to be sure. Gathering further intel on their ops is imperative. Other groups and clans don't pose any threat, with the startling exception of the Monolith. Something's growing out there, and it can't be any good. The only consolation is that Freedom will be the first ones hit by whatever those damn fanatics are brewing next.
How's Duty doing?

Solid three out of five - not great, not terrible. What's good is the shaky stability in terms of new fighters and their influx, fresh blood is trickling in - so not everything is lost. What's bad is the loss of much of our old blood, particularly Lt Colonel Shulga and the men at Yanov Station. With everything that's going on these days, having them around would've been helpful.
How did you lose your position in Yanov?

A weak link. A treacherous quartermaster by the name of Morgan was selling our best gear to Bandits and Mercenaries! Worse, he was caught in the act by free stalkers rather than our own men. I was presented with claims as a leader. It all left the faction badly weakened for when the Monolith returned. I ordered Shulga to pull back to Rostok when I first heard the news. Evidently he's not here, and there's still debate as to whether he's MIA or AWOL.
Understood.
What can you tell me about Duty's operations?
We often hire Free Stalkers as auxiliaries to take out minor but urgent threats that we don't have the manpower for. Petrenko will let you know what's available.
We used to safeguard Ecologists from Mercenary attacks, although it seems they have become pals these days. Although it's freed up manpower, I can't say I approve.

You might have noticed how stark and bold our armour is. While it sticks out easily during the day - when we act as a police force - it helps immeasurably when conducting our more aggressive operations at night.
We specialize in punitive operations - if an innocent is attacked, it is us who act as their avengers.
Purging mutant lairs is of great interest to us. We cannot have those disgusting beasts harassing the innocent.

One of our most successful operations involved infiltrating the Army Warehouses and stealing the cache of grenade launchers there from under Freedom's nose, without a single casualty on either side. The men involved were all awarded the Silver Shield.

We are one of the main factions in the Zone. But we are not like the other factions. You see, unlike them we have got a mission. We do not seek personal gain nor are we deceived by the Zone's many strange phenomena. Duty protects the innocent, and valiantly fends off the mutant threat. We alone stand in the way of its relentless advance to consume the planet whole. We alone endeavour to remove this grave threat permanently. In the meantime, we actively oppose those stalkers who present danger as well. The bandits, who selfishly extort others, as well as Freedom, the ignorant fools who are deluded by the Zone.
There's nothing more I wish to divulge at this time.
Tell me about yourself.

I used to be stationed at the Agroprom Research Institute before I got a promotion. Before the Zone came into existence, I was a car mechanic. Duty noticed my skills as a handyman after I had been around for a while, so they decided to assign me as technician here. I prefer tinkering with heavy firearms and assault weapons...I hate working on snipers, especially NATO ones.
What's that smell? Didn't think Duty allowed drinking.

Man, it's hard getting by without a drink. I wish I could've been at Yanov to help out when the Monolith hit, but then again I probably wouldn't be alive if I was relocated there. So many good men were lost defending that place...Huh, looks like we've gone way off topic. Anyway, don't be shy, now - show me your toys if you need 'em fixed.
I'll see if I have anything.
Who are you?

I'm a local informant, and I can offer you all kinds of services. At the moment, I have different types of information and maps with routes to various locations. My sources are some of the most reliable in the Zone, but they'll also kill to preserve their secrecy, so don't go asking where I learn this stuff - the answer isn't pretty.
Any free info can you share about the surrounding area?
Usually info is how I make a living, but since everything's quiet anyway, I can give you a bit of an insight. On the house.
I'm all ears.

Well, you're probably already familiar with everything south of here. Right now, you're in Rostok. It's completely safe if you're on good terms with Duty. East is the Truck Cemetery - like the Garbage, but much bigger, much more radioactive and much, much more dangerous. West is the Wild Territory - the parts of Rostok that Duty can't patrol regularly. That place is an absolute nightmare, and most stalkers recommend avoiding it unless you need to get to Yantar. North are the Army Warehouses, owned by Duty's "best friend", Freedom. Further north than that quickly becomes Monolith territory, defended by ruthless fanatics and brain-melting anomalous fields.
What can you tell me about the Monolith?

Allegedly, they are the guardians of an ancient alien crystal known as the "Wish Granter". The Monolith believe this crystal created the Zone, and that it will grant wishes to those it finds worthy. To this end, they'll fiercely defend it from anyone who dares step further than the northern Barrier at Army Warehouses. Of course, there are legends of people being found worthy of the Wish Granter, but it's all bullshit. There are easier ways to get rich, and you'd think by now someone would've wished for the mutants here to disappear, or for an end to disease, or even world peace - ha! But... I guess by the time you reach the Wish Granter, you don't give a shit about anyone else.
Thanks for the info.
Got any fresh information?
I've got information about the swamp doctor. You know, the crazy old man with the legendary healing powers? That's what they say, at least. I can tell you the truth, for seven thousand.
I'm listening.

As you might know, he lives in the Great Swamp. What you might not know is why he's there. He's waiting for his old friend, Strelok. With Strelok's rumoured return, many people want to meet the Doctor, but few ever find him. It's quite easy though - look for a breach in the fence along the northwest of the swamp, and watch out for the rads and anomalies along the way.
Got information about some stalker who recently raided the CNPP, for ten grand.
I'm all ears.

So, before the Monolith got all angry and rose up in earnest once again, this stalker was exploring the Sarcophagus for loot and - get this - he comes across a completely unique artefact! Apparently it's a shard of the Wish Granter itself! The Monolith didn't like that though, and he was forced to leave it behind to stop pursuit. One can only wonder what it is worth...
I have information that sheds light on Strelok's group, but only for fifteen grand.
Gimme.

Everyone knows Strelok recently managed to assemble a new team, but no one knows who they are. They're a band of uniquely skilled individuals - Stitch, Pathfinder, Rogue and Scope. A combat medic, a gifted guide, a military deserter and a top-tier sniper respectively. One can only wonder where they are now, or what they are up to.
I can reveal information about the adventures of a mysterious stalker who explored the Generators for twenty-four thousand.
Pass it.

Have you heard much about the Generators? Until recently, they were only considered a myth... but after Strelok's second campaign to the center of the Zone, there's no doubt they're real. There have been constant disputes about what they are, but old satellite imagery suggests some kind of weird infrastructure, in whose honor the entire area was named. Apparently, that's the place where Monolith carry out their orders and all important processes on the territory of the Zone. So, the stalker's already gone there and I think he's serious - his intervention might have a major impact on the Zone. The leaders of a few groups have already expressed their discontent regarding this information.
Not at the moment.
Not interested.
So, what do you do here for fun?
Fun? This place can get boring fast, man. Customers nowadays barely seek anything interesting. Just a bunch of amateurs who want to get their hands on artefacts and such, you know what I mean?
That's just the way it goes, isn't it?

Yeah, but don't any of them ever dream of doing something epic, something legendary? Like you, for instance - you seem experienced. Don't you want to accomplish something that people will never forget?
Go on...

I have a very special contact who is offering a huge reward for taking down ten stalkers. Fifty grand, plus sweets. Sounds like great cash for a simple list of bounties, right? Here's the interesting part: your targets just happen to be the top ten stalkers in the entire Zone. This means you could be hunting down regulars, Dutyers, Mercs or even the fucking Monolith themselves! You can see the list on your PDA if you want. This guy wants them dead, doesn't matter how.
What? That's insane! Why would anyone want this?
Count me in.
No thanks, I'm out of this.

I asked my contact something similar. Basically, he's tired of walking dreadnoughts vaccuuming up all the loot with their fancy rifles and expensive suits. He wants to give the common man more of a chance. Anyways, the pay will be incredible, so who cares?
Fantastic! I will upload the location of your first target onto your PDA. Every time you kill one of them, you get the location of the next guy. Have fun.
Suit yourself. The offer is still there if you change your mind.
Okay Snitch. It's done. Those ten targets are as good as dead.

Splendid work, pal! Our client is very happy with your results. As promised, here's your reward. Glad you were up to it after all - even now, I can hear people talking about your deeds. The killer of legends! This is gonna shake things up a bit, hehe...
I'd like to buy intel on a few routes.
Certainly. Here's what I've got.
From the Army Warehouses to Radar %c[d_orange][7000 RU]
So, do you have the money for it?
Yes, here you are.
From Radar to the bunker below it. %c[d_orange][11,000 RU]
Got the dough?
Of course. Here.
From Radar to Pripyat. %c[d_orange][9000 RU]
Have you got the cash?
Here you go.
From central Pripyat to the Outskirts. %c[d_orange][9000 RU]
I'll need the paper, first.
Yeah, here it is.
From Pripyat to the Chernobyl NPP. %c[d_orange][30,000 RU]
Have you got any money with you?
Yes, there you go.
Between the southern and northern parts of the Chernobyl NPP. %c[d_orange][35,000 RU]
Money first.
Here you are.
I don't have the money.
I've changed my mind.
Are you a guide?

Yep, Navigator's the name. Can take you to a few places for a modest fee. Rookies are my customers most of the time, but I can lead any experienced stalker as well - no shame in it. I'll break it down: you pay, I get you wherever you want to go and I return here. I can take you to Yantar, the Great Swamp, the Army Warehouses, the Garbage, the Cordon and Jupiter.
Sorry, where can you escort me?

To the the Garbage for seven hundred, the Army Warehouses for one thousand, the Rookie Village in the Cordon for three thousand, Yantar for thirty-five hundred, Yanov station in Jupiter for six thousand and the Great Swamp, also for six thousand.
I need to be led somewhere.
Yeah, where?
To the Cordon. %c[d_orange][3000 RU]
To the Garbage. %c[d_orange][700 RU]
To the Army Warehouses. %c[d_orange][1000 RU]
To Yantar. %c[d_orange][3500 RU]
To Jupiter. %c[d_orange][6000 RU]
To the Great Swamp. %c[d_orange][6000 RU]
I've changed my mind.
Who are you?

I'm a paramedic... used to be, at least. They call me Aspirin. Yeah, really. I can patch up any minor wounds, but as for serious injuries... Either a helicopter or the Zone itself will have to save you. And we rarely call in 'copters.
Do you sell, you know... "medicine"?
Hey, keep it down, the general's nearby. Yeah, we've got schmucks who sell that stuff, but I'm not one of them. I'll patch you up with the legitimate stuff, though.
Thanks.
Who do you have for me to fight?

So, your first fight? Your opponent is a piece of meat just like you. He's here because of his debts and he only has two options: to come out and fight, or to land himself in the nearest anomaly. He's gonna fight like a cornered animal. Equipment for today... Lemme think... How about you two use basic pistols, two boxes of ammo should be plenty. Either kick his ass or we feed you to the dogs - not much of a choice. Go on now.
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Your last fight didn't mean shit, you're still the same piece of meat you were before and no self-respecting person will bet a single mag on you. If you wanna earn some proper cash you're gonna have to make a few more appearances in the arena. Your new opponent also got through the first round, and his fight was a lot harder than yours. I don't like him, to be honest - he kills too quickly and the crowd doesn't like that. So, go and show us what you can do! The stakes will increase after this fight - all you gotta do is stay alive. Move it!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, well... You're not as much of a pussy as you first seemed. Now it's time to test you out in a real fight. You're up against two guys. The first one's called Swede and I don't remember the second one's name. They were paired up intentionally as they hate each other's guts so don't worry about them working as a team - they're more likely to shoot each other. Today is rifle day so don't let them get too close or we'll have to pick you up piece by piece. The odds are 10:1 so if you win you'll make a fair amount. Off you go!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, now I can safely say that you're a fighter, a real fighter. Now it's time for a team fight. You get to fight with two rookies - two brothers - on your side. They haven't fought yet but they're brothers, so I had to put them into a team fight. I wouldn't expect any real help from them if I were you. You're fighting an experienced team, they're contenders for the final this season. A dangerous lot. They use different weapons but one has an automatic shotgun - be very careful with him. Good luck, pal... You're gonna need it.
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

You've got a special fight today. Even the army has heard about you! Don't be surprised, they fight here too - there's even a general in the crowd. These guys are from the Spetsnaz or OMON. They're well armed and their armour is as good as you'd expect. Don't worry though, I ain't gonna leave you out in the rain, either. You'll get a vest used by Freedom - it's light so it won't slow you down. Go on, show them that stalkers ain't no whipping boys. Good luck!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Time for you to show what you can do. Duty captured a group of bandits that had been causing problems for stalkers near Rostok. Duty took 'em at night so most of the bandits were taken alive. They were all gonna be executed anyway so I convinced Duty to give them a chance. If any of them survive, they'll go in the can outside the Zone, which is better than dying here. They're not well-armed - probably just a few pistols and sawn-offs - but there's six of them so watch yourself. Go on now!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, you're almost in the final. Now you'll be fighting a real stalker. He's alone but he's got an assault rifle and he's inside a protective suit. Catch one burst and you're toast. There will be a surprise that I can't tell you about too... Here's my advice: be prepared, it's gonna be tough. The winner makes it through to the final. Fight to the death, go!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Congratulations, you're in the final! One more to go and this one is to the death, every man for himself. There will be 4 other stalkers in the arena: all real pros in exoskeletons but it's a fair deal this time - you'll get exactly what they have. The only thing is, you don't get medkits or bandages in a fight to the death. Ready? Go prove you're the best, GO!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.
Yo! You paid me for a fight but you just walked away!
Yo! I've got a new fight for you.
Go have a drink or something. The Arena ain't ready yet.
You've already become a pro!!!
You won! Here's your reward.
You're not experienced enough for this fight.
What challenge do you have for me?
There is nothing to fight, come again later when we have some more mutants.
There's a fee for participation. 1,000 RU.
Fine, here's your money.
I don't have enough money.
Then get out of here, stalker.
You owe me 2,000 RU for participation.
Fine, here's your money.
I already paid you!
I don't have enough money.
Then stop asking so many questions.
Pay 3,000 RU for participation and the bloodsucker is yours.
Fine. Here's your money.
I don't have enough.
Don't waste my time, stalker.
Not so fast. The price for participation is 5,000 RU.
Fine. Here's the money.
I don't have enough money.
Don't try pretending to be a beggar.
The price for participating is 5,000 RU.
Fine. Here's your money.
I don't have enough money.
Let me guess. Someone stole your roubles?
There's a pseudodog. A large specimen, but quite beaten up. On the other hand it's a very fierce one, just like my mother-in-law.
Deal. Before you fight you should place a stake on the time you need to make the kill. If you manage to pull it off you'll make yourself a little extra spending money.
30 seconds, triple win.
One and a half minutes, double win.
Without a time limit. A half-stake win.
I changed my mind.
Tough shit. You've already paid.
I can do that. I'll fight your dog.
A dog? Is that all you have?
Aw, is our girl afraid of a little doggie? Don't be upset.
There is a freak in a gas-mask, called a snork. Thin and feeble-looking but quite agile.
Great, we'll get everything ready. Enter the arena.
Bring it on. I'll fight your snork.
They make my stomach turn. Hell no.
Scared by a half-rotten gas-masked freak?
This time we've gotten truly lucky. We caught a young bloodsucker. Still dumb, but already with bad manners.
Go ahead, get the bloodsucker ready.
A bloodsucker? Fuck that!
What? You love bloodsuckers now? When did you join Freedom?
This time we've a fat little midget in a black cloak - the locals call it a burer.
Fat and short? Easy. I'll do it.
I've heard all about those things. I'll pass.
He hardly reaches your waist in height. And he scares you?
Today is a special day. I don't know where they found... Him... But he's a real beast.
Deal. I'll put him out of his misery.
I don't feel like dying, find someone else.
Well, frankly even I find the beast scary. But I'm not fighting in the arena, so who cares?
Got a couple of questions.
Shoot.
Never mind.
What is this establishment?
This is the arena, my little business. A place where stalkers can test their mettle and earn their fame by fighting against the horrors of the Zone.
How do you get the mutants here?

We made a deal with Duty, instead of killing all the mutants they find they bring the weaker ones here in exchange for cash. Duty gets paid, the mutants get killed, and then I get paid. Everybody wins.
Where are you from?
I am from many places. I heard about this little backwater and understood that I could earn a good little penny here. So here I am.
What are the rules?

Oh, the rules are pretty simple. I invented them myself. For challenges, there's a cage, and a mutant is let inside the cage. You pay money and tell me the time you need to kill the monster. If you make it - you win, if you don't - I win.\nBut for the main course, bandits and the Zone's other degenerates captured by Duty fight in the arena for their crimes. Some are just stalkers who fancy a fight, and not actually criminals, but whoever leaves the arena in the least amount of pieces gets a sizeable reward. If they keep on winning fights, then more stalkers will come to watch, and the combatants win larger rewards.
Good to see you stalker, welcome to the arena.
So, what are you waiting for? Get into the cage.
Sorry, there's nothing to fight against yet. Wait for a day or two until we can catch a new mutant.
There you are! Well done! Here's your win. If you desire another fight for money then just drop in whenever.
Sorry, bro, but you lose. Come again next time if you want.
Hey guy, how goes the Zone? So...I hope you have repair work that needs doing... Heh, I need some cash bad.
